dalserver
Class SiapMySql

java.lang.Object
  dalserver.SiapMySql

public class SiapMySql
extends java.lang.Object

SiapMySql provides a simple image access (SIAP) capability for any image collection which can be described via image metadata stored in a MySQL database.

Constructor Summary
SiapMySql(java.lang.String jdbcDriver)
          Constructor to generate a new MySql query object, providing the functionality to query a remote MySQL-hosted catalog.

          Test the SIAP MySQL interface.

          Query the remote metadata table, writing results as a SIAP query response to the output request response object.

                    java.lang.String database,
                    java.lang.String username,

             throws DalServerException
Connect to the remote database.

Parameters:
url - JDBC URL of the remote DBMS.
database - Database name within remote DBMS.
username - User name for database login.
password - User password for database login.
Throws:
DalServerException

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnect from the remote database.

query

public void query(SiapParamSet params,
                  RequestResponse response)
           throws DalServerException
Query the remote metadata table, writing results as a SIAP query response to the output request response object. The response object can later be serialized and returned in various output formats.

Parameters:
params - The SIAP service input parameters.
response - The request response object.
Throws:
DalServerException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Test the SIAP MySQL interface. 
   ingest [csv-file]    Turn a CSV version of the SIAP data model
                                into a SiapData class which contains raw data
                                defining the data model.

   doc [type]           Generate an HTML version of the SIAP keyword
                                dictionary.

   table [type]         Generate Java code to create the indicated
                                keywords in a RequestResponse object.
